question: True or false: event (Oliver Thompson was married to Charlie Evans) was longer in duration than event (Charlie Evans was married to Oliver Thompson)?

output:
<reasoning>
To determine if the event (Oliver Thompson was married to Charlie Evans) was longer in duration than the event (Charlie Evans was married to Oliver Thompson), we need to compare the durations of these two events. Both events start at the same time, 2000, and end at the same time, 2005. Therefore, the duration of both events is from 2000 to 2005, which is 5 years. Since both events have the same duration, it is not possible for one to be longer than the other.
<timeline>

(Charlie Evans was married to Oliver Thompson) starts at 2000 and ends at 2005.
